title: How to Keep Things Safe from Rust

steps.headline: Clean the surface completely.
steps.description: Remove the old paint by using wool brush or sanding paper.

steps.headline: Remove the sanding dust with a wet rag.
Apply metal primer.
steps.description: Primer is a basecoat paint which ensures topcoat paint adhesion, increasing durability.

steps.headline: Sand the surface again gently to create profile and remove dust with a wet rag.
Apply the paint using a suitable paintbrush because one of the cheapest and most effective ways to protect metal from rust is to apply paint.
Before starting, remove all the dirt from the item by using sandpaper or steel wool.
Dip the item into the cleaning solution for at least 15-20 minutes to remove oil, grease, and other dirt.
steps.description: Acetone or denatured alcohol can be used as a cleaning solution.

steps.headline: Once it is done, rinse the item for 5 minutes to remove cleaning solution from the surface.
Stir the bluing solution and heat it up to 135-155°C.
Dip the item into the bluing solution.
Leave the item in solution for 30-45 minutes.
steps.description: You can remove the solution or take out the item once a blue-black shade has appeared on it.

steps.headline: Dip the items in water-displacing oil bath and let it cool for 30-60 minutes.
Remove the rust spots from the item by using steel wool or sandpaper.
Immerse the item in cleaning solution for 10-15 minutes so that all dirt/rust can be removed.
Take the item out of the cleaning solution and rinse it properly to remove cleaning solution.
Now heat the item gently and apply bluing solution by using clean applicator.
Apply the solution again and again until you are satisfied with the blue-black color.

text: Use Proper Application of Paint Clean the surface completely. Remove the old paint by using wool brush or sanding paper. Remove the sanding dust with a wet rag.  Apply metal primer. Primer is a basecoat paint which ensures topcoat paint adhesion, increasing durability. Sand the surface again gently to create profile and remove dust with a wet rag.  Apply the paint using a suitable paintbrush because one of the cheapest and most effective ways to protect metal from rust is to apply paint.  Clean the surface regularly.  Use Bluing \/ Black Oxidizing Before starting, remove all the dirt from the item by using sandpaper or steel wool.  Dip the item into the cleaning solution for at least 15-20 minutes to remove oil, grease, and other dirt. Acetone or denatured alcohol can be used as a cleaning solution. Once it is done, rinse the item for 5 minutes to remove cleaning solution from the surface.  Stir the bluing solution and heat it up to 135-155°C.  Dip the item into the bluing solution.  Leave the item in solution for 30-45 minutes. You can remove the solution or take out the item once a blue-black shade has appeared on it. Dip the items in water-displacing oil bath and let it cool for 30-60 minutes.  Remove the rust spots from the item by using steel wool or sandpaper.  Immerse the item in cleaning solution for 10-15 minutes so that all dirt/rust can be removed.  Take the item out of the cleaning solution and rinse it properly to remove cleaning solution.  Now heat the item gently and apply bluing solution by using clean applicator.  Apply the solution again and again until you are satisfied with the blue-black color.
